column2: image=Ted Nasmith - Departure at the Grey Havens.jpg

column1: '''The Grey Havens''' is the ninth and final chapter of the second book of ''[[The Return of the King]]'', the final volume of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.
Now that [[the Shire]]'s brief police state had been overthrown,<ref>{{RK
column2: Scouring}}</ref> the [[Hobbits]] rebuilt the villages of the region. [[Samwise Gamgee
column3: Sam]] opened the box [[Galadriel]] had given him<ref>{{FR
column4: Farewell}}</ref> and found a small silver seed, which he planted. In the [[Party Field]], a [[Mallorn]] sprang up to replace the old tree that had been cut down. Many children were born that year. [[Meriadoc Brandybuck
column6: Pippin]] became heroes in the Shire, but [[Frodo Baggins
column7: Frodo]] quietly retired. That spring, Sam married [[Rose Cotton
column9: Farmer Cotton]]'s daughter, and they lived at [[Bag End]] with Frodo.

column1: Frodo decided to travel to [[Rivendell]] to see [[Bilbo Baggins]]. Frodo entrusted to Sam a history of the War, written in part by Bilbo. Frodo, Sam, and others set out. As they entered the [[Woody End]], they met [[Elrond]] and [[Galadriel]], who now wore two of the [[Three Rings
column2: Three Elven Rings]]. Riding slowly behind the two elves was Bilbo himself. Sam and Frodo accompanied the travellers to the [[Belegaer
column3: Great Sea]]. When they reached the gates of the [[Grey Havens]], they found [[Gandalf]], wearing the [[Narya
column4: last]] of the Three Rings, waiting for them. Beyond him was a great white ship, ready to sail to the West across the sea.

column1: Pippin and Merry appeared, wishing to be present at Frodo's departure. Frodo sadly bade farewell to his three friends, kissed them, and boarded the ship. Gandalf entreated the three hobbits to enjoy each other's friendship as they quietly returned to the Shire. Sam entered his warm home, where he found Rosie waiting. She put their young daughter, [[Elanor Gardner
column2: Elanor]], in his lap, and Sam drew a deep breath and said, "Well, I'm back."
